intro: Rhododendron atlanticum f. tomolobum, commonly known as the Tomolobum rhododendron, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partially shaded to sunny conditions. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for landscaping in suitable climates. This form is distinguished by its broader leaves and more open branching compared to the typical form of R. atlanticum.
